DB-Coffee-Store.description: The design and implementation of a database for an coffee beans store.

DevBuddy.name: DevBuddy
DevBuddy.description: DevBuddy is a website designed as a learning platform for aspiring web developers. It offers tutorials and exercises in key web programming languages.

muhtm.name: (AI) Muhtm My Graduation Project
muhtm.description: Muhtm is an AI-driven website tool specialized in aspect-based sentiment analysis. It's tailored to aid business owners in gaining profound insights from customer reviews by focusing on specific aspects of products or services.

hero.title: Software Engineer, AI, Making the world better, one software at a time.
description: As a software engineer, my capabilities were showcased during my internship, where I significantly contributed to redeveloping an internal portal for a department. Additionally, I played a key role in testing a new feature within an app built on a major financial system, during which I identified 3 bugs.

Independently, I also developed a Power BI dashboard to enhance the visualization of internal data. For My graduation project, "Muhtm," it is an AI-based tool for in-depth sentiment analysis of customer reviews, aiding business owners in product evaluation.
To explore more about my projects and professional journey, feel free to contact me or visit my LinkedIn profile.

quote.text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out. -Chris Pine

about.title: About Me
description: Nothing motivates me more than pain and its impact. Regardless of the source of pain, I always strive to channel it in a healthy way, And there is no greater pain than a bug that consumes hours of your time. What really motivates me is a challenge, and researching through a vast array of possibilities until I find the most efficient solution is exactly the challenge I enjoy. This approach is evident in how I treat my 3-year-old niece. I always encourage her to challenge herself, and I am there to support her, not to question her. I give her the confidence that she can figure things out on her own, but she knows that if she ever needs help, I will be there to support her. I believe that adults and children have more in common than they imagine, and I am convinced that a great work environment is one that empowers its employees while being there to support them. I can't wait to work in such a place.

I could spend a lot of time discussing my qualifications and what makes me good at what I do you can see that all over my portfolio and my LinkedIn account, but in this section?, I want to focus on why I am good at what I do, not just how.
"Why" stands for my personal traits, while "how" relates to qualifications, projects, and experiences that result from the "why." so why me?.

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.text: I'm always interested in backend and/or frontend development, whether it's for work or freelance opportunities. However, if you have other requests or questions, please don't hesitate to contact me.

description: Nothing motivates me more than pain and its impact. Regardless of the source of pain, I always strive to channel it in a healthy way, And there is no greater pain than a bug that consumes hours of your time. What really motivates me is a challenge, and researching through a vast array of possibilities until I find the most efficient solution is exactly the challenge I enjoy. This approach is evident in how I treat my 3-year-old niece. I always encourage her to challenge herself, and I am there to support her, not to question her. I give her the confidence that she can figure things out on her own, but she knows that if she ever needs help, I will be there to support her. I believe that adults and children have more in common than they imagine, and I am convinced that a great work environment is one that empowers its employees while being there to support them. I can't wait to work in such a place.

I could spend a lot of time discussing my qualifications and what makes me good at what I do you can see that all over my portfolio and my LinkedIn account, but in this section?, I want to focus on why I am good at what I do, not just how.
"Why" stands for my personal traits, while "how" relates to qualifications, projects, and experiences that result from the "why." so why me?.
why: Meaning-Driven: Each day, I dedicate the first hours to working or learning something new. This isn't a result of workaholism; rather, it's because I derive profound meaning from what I do.

The Fixer: From my early teenage years, I have been the go-to person for tech issues at home. I don‚Äôt like the frustration that comes from not understanding something and always beat it by understanding it and then fixing the thing.

High-Spirited: I take joy in my work and strongly believe in listening to one's inner voice to empower oneself and others. As a flexible individual, I adapt well to any environment and embrace change, which is why I thrive in the constantly evolving tech industry.

Advocate of Compound Effect: After reading "Atomic Habits" by James Clear in 2020, my life has transformed. I firmly believe in the power of habits. By maintaining a structured life and showing consistent effort, one can build momentum for achieving great things.

Inner Detective: When I feel down, I introspect to understand the underlying reasons. This skill extends to my interactions with team members, where I can quickly identify and address misunderstandings, fostering a healthier work environment.
